intro: Conopodium ferganense, commonly known as the Fergana bladder nut, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its fruits are dry, two-lobed capsules that contain smooth, oval seeds. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
